<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 90249 |area_code = [[Area code 310|310]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 06-01150 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1866995 |website = |footnotes = }} '''Alondra Park''', also known as '''El Camino Village''', is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]], [[California]], [[United States]]. It is the [[unincorporated area]] north of Alondra Park and [[El Camino College]]. It is east of [[Lawndale, California|Lawndale]], south of [[Hawthorne, California|Hawthorne]], west of [[Gardena, California|Gardena]], and north of [[Torrance, California|Torrance]]. [[Manhattan Beach Boulevard]] and [[Crenshaw Boulevard]] are the two major cross streets in the area. The population was 8,592 at the 2010 census, down from 8,622 at the 2000 census.
==Geography== Alondra Park is located about two miles (3 km) southeast of [[Hawthorne, California|Hawthorne]].<ref>[http://www.city-data.com/city/Alondra-Park-California.html http://www.city-data.com/city/Alondra-Park-California.html] ''city-data.com''</ref>
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|1.1|sqmi|km2}}. {{convert|1.1|sqmi|km2}} of it is land and {{convert|0.04|sqmi|km2}} of it (3.17%) is water.
==Demographics== {{USCensusPop |1970=12193 |1980=12096 |1990=12215 |2000=8622 |2010=8592 }} ===2010=== The [[2010 United States Census]]<ref>{{USCensus-2010CA}}</ref> reported that Alondra Park had a population of 8,592. The [[population density]] was 7,518.4 people per square mile (2,902.9/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of Alondra Park was 3,716 (43.2%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 806 (9.4%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 32 (0.4%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1,396 (16.2%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 48 (0.6%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 2,167 (25.2%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 427 (5.0%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 4,304 persons (50.1%).
The Census reported that 8,527 people (99.2% of the population) lived in households, 59 (0.7%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 6 (0.1%) were institutionalized.
There were 2,719 households, out of which 1,198 (44.1%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 1,383 (50.9%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 442 (16.3%) had a female householder with no husband present, 223 (8.2%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 174 (6.4%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 17 (0.6%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 513 households (18.9%) were made up of individuals and 132 (4.9%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.14. There were 2,048 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (75.3% of all households); the average family size was 3.56.
The population was spread out with 2,332 people (27.1%) under the age of 18, 818 people (9.5%) aged 18 to 24, 2,581 people (30.0%) aged 25 to 44, 2,091 people (24.3%) aged 45 to 64, and 770 people (9.0%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 33.7 years. For every 100 females there were 97.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 95.4 males.
There were 2,818 housing units at an average density of 2,465.9 per square mile (952.1/kmÂ²), of which 1,362 (50.1%) were owner-occupied, and 1,357 (49.9%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 0.7%; the rental vacancy rate was 4.1%. 4,188 people (48.7% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 4,339 people (50.5%) lived in rental housing units.
===2000=== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 8,622 people, 2,830 households, and 2,046 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 7,562.4 inhabitants per square mile (2,920.2/kmÂ²). There were 2,933 housing units at an average density of 2,572.6 per square mile (993.4/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 41.57% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 12.62% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.81% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 16.32% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.42% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 22.04% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 6.23% from two or more races. 40.90% of the population were [[Hispanics in the United States|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race.
There were 2,830 households out of which 40.4% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 49.6% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 15.2% had a female householder with no husband present, and 27.7% were non-families. 20.8% of all households were made up of individuals and 5.9% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.05 and the average family size was 3.56.
In the CDP the population was spread out with 29.5% under the age of 18, 9.8% from 18 to 24, 33.2% from 25 to 44, 19.1% from 45 to 64, and 8.4% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 32 years. For every 100 females there were 101.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 100.9 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $39,722, and the median income for a family was $45,852. Males had a median income of $33,000 versus $28,494 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $17,175. About 15.8% of families and 19.1% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 25.1% of those under age 18 and 6.2% of those age 65 or over.
==Politics== The [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]] (LASD) operates the Lennox Station in [[Lennox, California|Lennox]], serving El Camino Village (Alondra Park).<ref>"[http://www.lasd.org/stations/for2/lennox/index.html Lennox Station]." [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]. Retrieved on January 21, 2010.</ref><ref>"[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/MapItDrawServlet?geo_id=16000US0641180&_bucket_id=50&tree_id=420&context=saff&_lang=en&_sse=on Lenox CDP]." [[U.S. Census Bureau]]. Retrieved on January 21, 2010.</ref>
In the [[California State Legislature|state legislature]] Alondra Park is located in the 25th [[California State Senate|Senate]] District, represented by Democrat [[Edward Vincent]], and in the 51st [[California State Assembly|Assembly]] District, represented by Democrat [[Curren D. Price Jr.]]. Federally, Alondra Park is located in [[California's 35th congressional district]], which has a [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVI]] of D +33<ref>{{cite web | title = Will Gerrymandered Districts Stem the Wave of Voter Unrest? | publisher = Campaign Legal Center Blog | url=http://www.clcblog.org/blog_item-85.html | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> and is represented by Democrat [[Maxine Waters]].
==Education== ===Primary and secondary schools=== Alondra Park is served by the [[Lawndale Elementary School District]]. Two elementary schools, Franklin D. Roosevelt Elementary School and Mark Twain Elementary School, are located inside and serve portions of Alondra Park.<ref name="CDPMap">"[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/MapItDrawServlet?geo_id=16000US0601150&_bucket_id=50&tree_id=420&context=saff&_lang=en&_sse=on Alondra Park CDP, California]." [[U.S. Census Bureau]]. Retrieved on May 5, 2010.</ref><ref name="Zonemap">"[http://www.lawndale.k12.ca.us/aboutLESD/boundarymap.jsp?rn=1089715 Elementary School & Middle School Boundaries as of September 2008]." [[Lawndale Elementary School District]]. Retrieved on May 5, 2010.</ref> In addition Kit Carson Elementary School is inside Alondra Park<!--Carson does not appear in the zone boundary--><ref name="CDPMap"/> Residents are zoned to Rogers Middle School in [[Lawndale, California|Lawndale]].<ref name="Zonemap"/> For high school residents are in the [[Centinela Valley Union High School District]].
===Colleges and universities=== [[El Camino College]] is partially inside Alondra Park.<ref name="CDPMap"/>
===Public libraries=== [[County of Los Angeles Library]] operates the Masao W. Satow Library, located in Alondra Park.<ref name="CDPMap"/><ref name="Satow">"[http://www.colapublib.org/libs/satow/ Masao W. Satow Library]." ''[[County of Los Angeles Public Library]]''. Retrieved on April 21, 2009.</ref>
In 1913 the Moneta Branch was formed. In 1919 the Strawberry Park branch was formed. In 1958 the Strawberry Park and Moneta branches merged into the West Gardena Branch. In 1969 a fire forced the West Gardena branch to go to a new location. The current Satow building, dedicated on February 26, 1977, was named after a [[Japanese American]] in the community.<ref name="Satow"/>
